results.title: Eating Raoul
results.creator_credit: Paul Bartel, Anne Kimmel, Quartet Films, Quartet, International Classis and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Paul and Mary Bland, an endearingly middle-class couple, want to get out of their swinger-infested apartment building and open a nice little restaurant in the country. However, real estate is expensive and Paul has just lost his job. So, they take out a kinky ad and then knock off the rich swingers who answer it…Enter Raoul.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Bartel, Anne Kimmel, Quartet Films, Quartet, International Classis and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: J.M. Turner. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Colin Clark and John Brabourne Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Romantic vs classic art”.
Reviews the neglected works of Turner, concentrating on alpine scenes which show how he completely understood nature. One of the series of films written and narrated by Sir Kenneth Clark on the painters and sculptors who from 1750 to 1900 engaged in the struggle between the classic and romantic ideals.

results.title: Edgar Degas
results.creator_credit: Colin Clark, Sothebys and John Brabourne Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Romantic vs classic art”.
Shows how Degas turned again and again to two themes, horse-racing and the ballet, and his use of photography as an aid to composition. Written and narrated by Kenneth Clark

results.title: The Goddess and the poet
results.creator_credit: David Meagher, Roberto Salvatore and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet Christos Raskatos, old fashioned romantic. Meet him as a poet who has a love affair with words, as a local in love with Lorne and as a guy who catches a crayfish now and then in paradise. Interview taken at Lorne Fisheries, Lorne Pier.
results.description: Meet Christos Raskatos, old fashioned romantic. Meet him as a poet who has a love affair with words, as a local in love with Lorne and as a guy who catches a crayfish now and then in paradise. Interview taken at Lorne Fisheries, Lorne Pier.

results.title: Ecology and dreams
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: A dream for Lizzie and Shayne to make a difference in our world has become a reality in their little part of it. Together they have established the award-winning Cape Otway Centre for Conservation Ecology.
